incident_updates.body: We experienced an issue which caused API requests to return an elevated number of 500 and 401 responses in error. The issue has been resolved.

incidents.name: LinkedIn API Elevated Errors with Refresh Tokens

incident_updates.body: We have resolved the issue for the usage of the Refresh tokens.

We are currently experiencing an issue across the platform that may cause some refresh token returned from /introspectToken API as active, but unable to generate access tokens.
We are investigating the issue and working on a resolution.

We started ramping mandatory two-step verification from 10/2/2023 to 10/23/2023 which inadvertently removed third party applications from the members profile settings; revoking three legged OAuth tokens for the member.  Developers may have seen an increase in 401 REVOKED_ACCESS_TOKEN errors during this time.  We have since paused this ramp.  Members who enabled two-step verification during this time will need to re-authenticate in any third party application.
This issue has been resolved.
We are currently experiencing an issue across the platform that may cause some API requests to take longer or fail unexpectedly. We are investigating the issue and working on a resolution.

We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: LinkedIn Marketing Solutions API Elevated Errors

incident_updates.body: We're experiencing an elevated level of API errors with our LinkedIn Marketing Solutions services resulting in "Can not determine the ACL for x" error messages.   The issue started at 3:30pm PT and fully recovered at 8:35pm PT.

incidents.name: LinkedIn API increased latency or elevated errors

incident_updates.body: High latency or errors for the organizationalEntityShareStatistics endpoint
The issue was resolved by 5:50 AM  On Sep 27th, 2021 and the API platform went back to normal.

On Monday, Sep 27th, 2021, From 3:30 AM, we experienced an issue across the platform that may have caused some API requests to take longer or fail unexpectedly. The issue was resolved in around 2 hours and the API platform went back to normal.

We experienced an outage with our home page feed across the platform on 9/21/2021 from approximately 4:24pm PST to 5:33pm PST that impacted impressions, clicks, video views, engagement for organic and sponsored content, shares, posts, video ads, carousel ads, dynamic ads, text ads. Issue has since been completely resolved.
We have merged the resolution and are closely monitoring the API behavior.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.

We are currently experiencing issues across the platform that may cause some Job Posting APIs to fail with 500 error codes. We have identified the issue and working on a resolution. Tentative ETA for resolution will be 20th Sep 2021.

incidents.name: LinkedIn Marketing Solutions API Elevated Errors

incident_updates.body: We experienced an issue with the Marketing Developer APIs from approximately 9/13/2021 10:17AM PT to 9/13/2021 12:38PM PT that may have caused some API requests to take longer or fail unexpectedly with 500 or 504 status code errors. The issue has since been resolved.

From approximately 9/13/21 1:15PM PT to 9/20/21 4:30PM PT, we experienced an issue across the mobile platform preventing new users from obtaining an OAuth access token. The issue has since been resolved, and a fix is underway to prevent this issue from appearing going forward.
